image.altText: nadine lont upset

props.synopsis: Medical staff at one of Victoria's biggest regional hospitals have told the ABC that for every death at the facility, there are many close calls. Grieving and angry parents are demanding an independent investigation into staffing and care standards.

title.children: Parents' plea for answers after three child deaths at hospital in six weeks

image.altText: A bearded man holds his hand to his forehead

props.synopsis: As the British and French leaders head to Washington separately this week to meet with Donald Trump, Europe is wondering if the US is still its ally, writes Bridget Rollason.

title.children: Trump sidelined Europe from Ukraine talks — exactly what Putin wants

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Airservices Australia representatives tell a parliamentary hearing that almost 50 flights were forced to divert after China signalled it was conducting the hazardous drills in busy international airspace.

title.children: Chinese 'live fire' military exercise forced nearly 50 flight diversions

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping. Both are wearing a blue suit, blue tie and have a neutral facial expression.

props.synopsis: China's economic fortunes were improving before Donald Trump's re-election, but his return to the White House seems to have inspired Xi Jinping to bring Beijing's business leaders in from the cold.

title.children: How Donald Trump could help make China's economy great again

image.altText: a close up of the microsoft logo, a window coloured red, green, blue, yellow

props.synopsis: Microsoft has increased the price of its Microsoft 365 subscriptions, which it says has new AI features, but the price hike caused consumer outrage.

title.children: 'Arrogance is astounding': Microsoft hikes subscription prices causing consumer backlash

image.altText: Unidentified woman receives a mammogram.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists said an aging population, alcohol consumption and low physical activity could all be contributing to the country's high breast cancer rate.

title.children: Australians record highest breast cancer diagnosis rate in the world

image.altText: Proxy twins visit Queensland hospital

props.synopsis: Last year saw an increase in the number of organ donors, but as donors age and families refuse permission, fewer Australians are receiving life-saving donations.

title.children: Organ donors desperately needed as fewer Australians getting transplants

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: With land cheaper in the outer suburbs, families are opting to live in neighbourhoods that often lack basic health, education, retail and transport services. How long does it take for people to comfortably call these places home?

title.children: As Australian cities sprawl, outer suburbs are lacking basic services

image.altText: Woman in red scarf and black hijab stands in a well decorated room with green walls, green and gold cushions, carpet, curtains.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its soldiers fired into the home in a small village near the city of Jenin because they believed Palestinian militants were inside. Instead, the gunfire left a young mother covered in her only child's blood.

title.children: Palestinian mum seeks answers after 2yo killed in IDF strikes on Jenin

image.altText: Trump shakes hands with French President Emmanuel Macron at the White House

props.synopsis: The French president's visit to Washington comes amid alarm in Europe over Mr Trump's hardening stance toward Ukraine.

title.children: Emmanuel Macron meets Donald Trump for White House talks on Ukraine

image.altText: Flood plume from Burdekin River captured on Feb 18 Courtesy Copernicus Sentinel 2

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals huge amounts of floodwater heading into the ocean and towards parts of the Great Barrier Reef ahead of more potential severe weather.

title.children: Satellite photos show flood run-off flowing towards parts of Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Two nuns bow their heads.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was admitted to hospital in Rome on February 14 with breathing difficulties and his clinical picture has been described as "complex" and "critical".

title.children: Public prayers for Pope after 'slight improvement', prognosis 'not decided'

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister has been called out for not doing enough to protect Australians from race-based violence as he faced voters in a special live Q+A.

title.children: 'Your family should feel safe here': PM confronts racism concern

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Mobile voice and SMS connectivity would be extended across Australia under a Labor election pledge to update Australia's universal service obligation.

title.children: Labor pledges to expand voice and SMS coverage across Australia

image.altText: A sketch of an old bald man wearing thin glasses and a brown jacket

props.synopsis: Joel Le Scouarnec faces charges of aggravated rape and sexual assault against hundreds of victims, most of them children at the time of the alleged offence. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: Ex-surgeon accused of assaulting 299 patients goes on trial in France

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Rob Stefanic holds his hands together while giving evidence at senate estimates

props.synopsis: The President of the Senate, Sue Lines, has confirmed the federal parliament's presiding officers sacked Department of Parliamentary Services secretary Rob Stefanic after a "loss of trust and confidence" in him.

title.children: Federal parliament boss sacked after 'loss of trust and confidence'

image.altText: Sandstone gates of the Bathurst prison.

props.synopsis: A NSW jail that has been operating continuously for more than 130 years should be partially closed, according to a new report by the state's prison inspector.

title.children: Prison inspector calls to close 'dark, dilapidated' cells built in 1880s

image.altText: Jane Hume looks shocked in a parliamentary committee

props.synopsis: Additional emissions from adopting the Coalition's nuclear plan equate to 200 years of domestic air travel for Australia, a new analysis from the Climate Change Authority reveals.

title.children: Senator threatens climate body after nuclear 'carbon bomb' report

image.altText: Two men speaking

props.synopsis: Donald Trump continues to push Ukraine to provide the US with minerals to repay Washington for wartime aid. Here's what minerals Ukraine has and why the US wants a share.

title.children: Trump is demanding half of Ukraine's rare earth minerals and China may be why

image.altText: Jack Ginnivan, Nick Watson and Connor Macdonald sit on the fence to celebrate with Hawks fans

props.synopsis: Hawthorn was one of the stories of 2024, winning admirers and driving opponents crazy in equal measure. Now in 2025, the Hawks have an oversized target on their backs.

title.children: The hunted and hated Hawks are ready to take on the world

image.altText: Dorcy Rugamba looking up and to the side, standing with arms folded, slightly smiling.

props.synopsis: One of the stand-out shows at this year's Adelaide Festival is a devastating performance of love for family and for country. In it, audiences hear from a renowned Rwandan playwright who refused to let anger ruin him.

title.children: When Dorcy's family were killed, anger froze him. Telling his story helped

image.altText: Two men standing with fruit vines in the background

props.synopsis: A 15 kilometre "suspension zone" was enacted in January after Queensland fruit fly maggots were found in homegrown peaches at Glynde, north-east of the Adelaide CBD. Two Adelaide Hills strawberry growers are calling for changes to national fruit fly protocols.

title.children: Fruit fly was found in the suburbs, up the hill, growers aren't allowed to sell their fruit

image.altText: Sheikh Wesam Charkawi stands outdoors

props.synopsis: An Imam who is a student support officer at a high school in Sydney's west has been told to work from home over alleged breaches to the NSW Department of Education's social media policy and code of ethics.

title.children: Muslim Vote convener warned by employer over Sydney nurses comments

image.altText: Fire crews and police outside the Russian consulate in Marseille.

props.synopsis: According to the Russian consul general, there were no casualties from the explosion inside the Russian consulate in Marseille.

title.children: Russia says explosion in Marseille consulate shows signs of 'terrorist attack'

image.altText: Honoree Jane Fonda accepts the SAG Life Achievement Award onstage during the 31st Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards

props.synopsis: The 87-year-old actor and activist made the most of her time on stage while accepting the SAG Life Achievement Award.

title.children: 'I'm not done': Jane Fonda lights up SAG awards with fiery speech

image.altText: A brightly coloured map showing the progress of a cyclone that has formed off the north-east coast of Australia.

props.synopsis: The storm is expected to continue to gain strength as it slowly moves over the Coral Sea.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Alfred intensifies into category two system

image.altText: Friedrich Merz at an indoors press conference with the CDU political party logo over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Friedrich Merz, whose party won the most seats in Germany's federal election, is likely to become the next chancellor.

title.children: New German leader says Europe must seek 'independence' from US

image.altText: A man with graying hair in a blue suit looks serious at a press conference

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Commerce and Consumer Affairs Minister Andrew Bayly has resigned his ministerial positions after what he described as an "animated discussion" that ended with him putting a hand on a staffer's arm.

title.children: New Zealand minister resigns position after 'overbearing' incident with staffer

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in a Tasmanian court via phone to face allegations he stole a car in the Huon Valley, south of Hobart.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces Hobart court on car theft charge

image.altText: A woman is approached by an airport worker as she walks through the security area of the airport.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes a woman's behaviour as "extremely bizarre" as he sentences her for evading security staff and running out onto the tarmac at Canberra Airport in 2023.

title.children: 'Extremely bizarre': Woman fined for running onto Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: A NSW Marine Rescue boat on the water.

props.synopsis: Marine police say a missing fisherman reeled in a mako shark and then lost his footing before being dragged under water 55 kilometres off the NSW coast.

title.children: Missing Sydney fisherman pulled overboard by mako shark

image.altText: A tightly cropped image of Canberra Raiders teammates Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies in the midst of a try celebration.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders players Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies will front the media over an incident in their hotel in Las Vegas ahead of the NRL season opener.

title.children: NRL stars involved in Las Vegas hotel incident days before season opener

image.altText: A man in a suit.

props.synopsis: Letters sighted by the ABC confirm the Medical Board of Australia has referred Thomas Brough to the State Administrative Tribunal to answer claims of professional misconduct.

title.children: Liberal candidate's LGBTQI+ commentary sees him referred for misconduct

image.altText: The logo of crypto exchange platform Bybit with bitcoins around it

props.synopsis: The Dubai-based platform Bybit said an attacker gained control of an Ethereum wallet and transferred its holdings to an unknown address.

title.children: Hackers steal $2.4bn from crypto exchange Bybit in 'largest heist' of all time
